detaileddescription.para: USB endpoint direction and number.
Get endpoint index (number) from endpoint address
Get direction from endpoint address
Get endpoint address from endpoint index and direction
True if the endpoint is an IN endpoint
True if the endpoint is an OUT endpoint
USB endpoint Transfer Type mask.
USB endpoint Synchronization Type mask.

simplesect.para: Valid only for Isochronous Endpoints

detaileddescription.para: USB error reported by the controller
USB reset
USB connection established, hardware enumeration is completed
USB configuration done
USB connection lost
USB connection suspended by the HOST
USB connection resumed by the HOST
USB interface selected
Set Feature ENDPOINT_HALT received
Clear Feature ENDPOINT_HALT received
Start of Frame received
Initial USB connection status
Status codes reported by the registered device status callback.
SETUP received
Out transaction on this EP, data is available for read
In transaction done on this EP
Status Codes reported by the registered endpoint callback.
Control type endpoint
Isochronous type endpoint
Bulk type endpoint
Interrupt type endpoint
No Synchronization
Asynchronous
Adaptive
Synchronous

simplesect.para: Valid only for Isochronous Endpoints

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* usb_dc_ep_callback) (uint8_t ep, enum usb_dc_ep_cb_status_code cb_status)
memberdef.name: usb_dc_ep_callback

detaileddescription.para: Callback function signature for the USB Endpoint status

memberdef.definition: typedef void(* usb_dc_status_callback) (enum usb_dc_status_code cb_status, const uint8_t *param)
memberdef.name: usb_dc_status_callback

detaileddescription.para: Callback function signature for the device
Function to attach USB for device connection. Upon success, the USB PLL is enabled, and the USB device is now capable of transmitting and receiving on the USB bus and of generating interrupts.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail.

detaileddescription.para: Function to detach the USB device. Upon success, the USB hardware PLL is powered down and USB communication is disabled.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail.

detaileddescription.para: This function returns the USB device and firmware back to it's initial state. N.B. the USB PLL is handled by the usb_detach function

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail.

parameterdescription.para: Device address

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail.

briefdescription.para: Set USB device controller status callback.

detaileddescription.para: Function to set USB device controller status callback. The registered callback is used to report changes in the status of the device controller. The status code are described by the usb_dc_status_code enumeration.

parameterdescription.para: Callback function

detaileddescription.para: Function to check capabilities of an endpoint. usb_dc_ep_cfg_data structure provides the endpoint configuration parameters: endpoint address, endpoint maximum packet size and endpoint type. The driver should check endpoint capabilities and return 0 if the endpoint configuration is possible.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint config

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail.

detaileddescription.para: Function to configure an endpoint. usb_dc_ep_cfg_data structure provides the endpoint configuration parameters: endpoint address, endpoint maximum packet size and endpoint type.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint config

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail.

briefdescription.para: Set stall condition for the selected endpoint.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint address corresponding to the one listed in the device configuration table

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail.

briefdescription.para: Clear stall condition for the selected endpoint.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint address corresponding to the one listed in the device configuration table

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail.

briefdescription.para: Check if the selected endpoint is stalled.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint address corresponding to the one listed in the device configuration table
Endpoint stall status

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint address corresponding to the one listed in the device configuration table

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail.

detaileddescription.para: Function to enable the selected endpoint. Upon success interrupts are enabled for the corresponding endpoint and the endpoint is ready for transmitting/receiving data.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint address corresponding to the one listed in the device configuration table

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail.

detaileddescription.para: Function to disable the selected endpoint. Upon success interrupts are disabled for the corresponding endpoint and the endpoint is no longer able for transmitting/receiving data.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint address corresponding to the one listed in the device configuration table

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail.

detaileddescription.para: This function flushes the FIFOs for the selected endpoint.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint address corresponding to the one listed in the device configuration table

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail.

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint8_t ep, const uint8_t *const data, const uint32_t data_len, uint32_t *const ret_bytes)
memberdef.name: usb_dc_ep_write

briefdescription.para: Write data to the specified endpoint.

detaileddescription.para: This function is called to write data to the specified endpoint. The supplied usb_ep_callback function will be called when data is transmitted out.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint address corresponding to the one listed in the device configuration table
Pointer to data to write
Length of the data requested to write. This may be zero for a zero length status packet.
Bytes scheduled for transmission. This value may be NULL if the application expects all bytes to be written

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail.

memberdef.argsstring: (const uint8_t ep, uint8_t *const data, const uint32_t max_data_len, uint32_t *const read_bytes)
memberdef.name: usb_dc_ep_read

briefdescription.para: Read data from the specified endpoint.

detaileddescription.para: This function is called by the endpoint handler function, after an OUT interrupt has been received for that EP. The application must only call this function through the supplied usb_ep_callback function. This function clears the ENDPOINT NAK, if all data in the endpoint FIFO has been read, so as to accept more data from host.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint address corresponding to the one listed in the device configuration table
Pointer to data buffer to write to
Max length of data to read
Number of bytes read. If data is NULL and max_data_len is 0 the number of bytes available for read should be returned.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail.

briefdescription.para: Set callback function for the specified endpoint.

detaileddescription.para: Function to set callback function for notification of data received and available to application or transmit done on the selected endpoint, NULL if callback not required by application code. The callback status code is described by usb_dc_ep_cb_status_code.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint address corresponding to the one listed in the device configuration table
Callback function

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail.

briefdescription.para: Read data from the specified endpoint.

detaileddescription.para: This is similar to usb_dc_ep_read, the difference being that, it doesn't clear the endpoint NAKs so that the consumer is not bogged down by further upcalls till he is done with the processing of the data. The caller should reactivate ep by invoking usb_dc_ep_read_continue() do so.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint address corresponding to the one listed in the device configuration table
Pointer to data buffer to write to
Max length of data to read
Number of bytes read. If data is NULL and max_data_len is 0 the number of bytes available for read should be returned.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail.

briefdescription.para: Continue reading data from the endpoint.

detaileddescription.para: Clear the endpoint NAK and enable the endpoint to accept more data from the host. Usually called after usb_dc_ep_read_wait() when the consumer is fine to accept more data. Thus these calls together act as a flow control mechanism.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint address corresponding to the one listed in the device configuration table

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail.

parameterdescription.para: Endpoint address corresponding to the one listed in the device configuration table

simplesect.para: Enpoint max packet size (mps)

briefdescription.para: Start the host wake up procedure.

detaileddescription.para: Function to wake up the host if it's currently in sleep mode.

simplesect.para: 0 on success, negative errno code on fail.

detaileddescription.para: This file contains the USB device controller APIs. All device controller drivers should implement the APIs described in this file.
